name: Ronan Keating
description:
'''Ronan Patrick John Keating''' (born 3 March 1977) is an Irish singer, songwriter and media personality. He debuted in 1993 alongside [[Keith Duffy]], [[Michael Graham (singer)|Michael Graham]], [[Shane Lynch]], and [[Stephen Gately]], as the co-lead singer (with Gately) of Irish pop group [[Boyzone]]. His solo career started in 1999 and he has recorded eleven albums. He gained worldwide attention when his single "[[When You Say Nothing at All#Ronan Keating version|When You Say Nothing At All]]" was featured in the film ''[[Notting Hill (film)|Notting Hill]]'' and reached number one in several countries.

As a solo artist, Keating has sold over 20 million records worldwide alongside the 25 million records with Boyzone.  In Australia, he is best known as a judge on ''[[All Together Now (2018 Australian TV series)|All Together Now]]'' (2018), ''[[The X Factor (Australian TV series)|The X Factor]]'' (2010–14), and as a coach on ''[[The Voice (Australian TV series)|The Voice Australia]]'' (2016, 2025). He has also served as a coach on ''[[The Voice Kids (British TV series)|The Voice Kids UK]]'' (2022–23) and ''[[The Voice of Germany]]'' (2023). He hosted a breakfast show on [[Magic (UK radio station)|Magic Radio]] for seven years, ending in July 2024. Keating is active in charity work and has been a charity campaigner for the [[Marie Keating Foundation]], which raises awareness for [[breast cancer]] and is named after his mother, who died from the disease in 1998.
